page.title: 06River Keeper on the Dulais.
page.content: The water bailiff or{River Keeper as he prefers to be called has a wide and varied set of duties to perform. Besides checking on anglers to see if they are in possession of a permit to fish, the{River Keeper}also checks if the fish which have been caught are of the permitted size and that no more than the stated quantity have been taken. The reason why he prefers to be called the{River Keeper}is that his duties also include ensuring that the river is free of pollution and that the area is safe for anglers to use. In cases where pollution has been detected or there is serious danger from the river underwashing the banks then the{River Keeper}notifies the Water Board authorities who can then deal with the problem.
